snippet: This 1936 play, created by the Living Newspaper Unit of the W.P.A.’s Federal Theater Project, has been given a devoted if rickety revival.
abstract: Alexis Soloski reviews Metropolitan Playhouse revival of 1936 play Injunction Granted, originally created by Living Newspaper Unit of WPA's Federal Theater Project and directed by Alex Roe.
lead_paragraph: This 1936 play, created by the Living Newspaper Unit of the W.P.A.’s Federal Theater Project, has been given a devoted if rickety revival.

headline.main: Review: Metropolitan Playhouse Tackles Labor History in ‘Injunction Granted’
headline.print_headline: Surveying the Wages of Labor War
